title: 'Charade at Pakâ€™s behest': India calls arbitration court under Indus treaty 'illegal'
content: India has rejected the Court of Arbitration under the Indus Waters Treaty as illegal, refusing to recognize its authority to hear cases related to the Kishenganga and Ratle hydropower projects. The government emphasized that the court's formation violated the 1960 treaty, deeming its proceedings and decisions void. Furthermore, India has placed the treaty in abeyance until Pakistan ceases cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Not on students' union list': TMC distances itself from Kolkata gangrape prime accused
content: The Trinamool Congress (TMC) has distanced itself from Manujit Mishra, the prime accused in a college gangrape case, amidst accusations from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of his affiliation with the party. The TMC denies any link to the incident, emphasizing that justice should be based on the crime, not political affiliation.

title: Historic! Praggnanandhaa clinches UzChess Cup Masters title, becomes India no.1
content: Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa has ascended to India's No. 1 chess player, securing the UzChess Cup Masters title by defeating Nodirbek Abdusattorov. This victory propelled his live rating to 2778.3, ranking him World No. 4 and surpassing Viswanathan Anand in live classical ratings. This triumph signifies a generational shift in Indian chess, marking Praggnanandhaa's arrival as the nation's new chess leader.

title: Tied up, locked, many without clothes: 42 elderly rescued from Noida old-age home
content: In Noida, Uttar Pradesh, authorities rescued 42 elderly residents from an illegal old-age home. Disturbing conditions were uncovered, including women tied up and others locked in basement-like rooms. The facility, Anand Niketan Vridha Seva Ashram, lacked government authorization, prompting an investigation and relocation of the rescued individuals to government-approved facilities.

title: 'Mask has come off': Rahul flays RSS over call to drop 'secular' from Constitution
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the RSS following Dattatreya Hosabale's call to remove "socialist and secular" from the Constitution's Preamble. Gandhi argues that the RSS opposes the Constitution's emphasis on equality, secularism, and justice, accusing them of seeking to replace it with Manusmriti to disenfranchise the poor.

title: Americaâ€™s China threat: Huaweiâ€™s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: 'You'll be 90 metres away': Neeraj Chopra surprises fan with paid trip to NC Classic; post goes viral
content: Neeraj Chopra, the Olympic medallist, has delighted a fan by offering an all-expenses-paid trip to the inaugural Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru after the fan requested financial assistance on social media. This generous act underscores the importance of the NC Classic, India's first World Athletics Category 'A' Javelin competition, featuring top international athletes.

title: 'What can be done if ... ': TMC leader's controversial remark on Kolkata rape case
content: Kalyan Banerjee, a Trinamool Congress leader, made a controversial statement regarding the Kolkata law college rape case. He questioned the possibility of preventing such incidents between friends. A student was allegedly raped within the college premises on June 25. Police arrested three men, including a former student leader Manojit Mishra. Mishra has connections with senior Trinamool Congress leaders.

title: IND v ENG: After Leeds heroics, Pant on the brink of joining cricket's elite
content: Rishabh Pant stands on the verge of joining cricket legends like Don Bradman and Rahul Dravid. As Team India prepares for the Edgbaston Test, Pant aims to achieve a rare feat: scoring centuries in three consecutive Tests in England. His previous Edgbaston innings of 146 in 2022 showcased his brilliance.

title: Meta CTO in Town Hall: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman is lying, 'we did not ...'
content: A public dispute has erupted between OpenAI and Meta over AI talent recruitment. Sam Altman accused Meta of offering exorbitant sums, including $100 million, to poach OpenAI employees. Andrew Bosworth refuted these claims, asserting Meta is winning the talent war and that Altman is exaggerating due to Meta's success in attracting OpenAI researchers.

title: 'Brightest blast I've ever seen': Fighter pilot recalls Iran strike by B-2 bombers
content: In June 2025, the US military executed 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' a strike on Iran's Fordo nuclear site, culminating years of meticulous planning and weapon development. The mission, authorized by President Trump, involved B-2 crews deploying GBU-57 bunker-busters to target the facility's vent shafts. While the US asserts 'total obliteration,' Iran disputes the impact, though the IAEA confirmed extensive damage.

title: Kolkata shocker: Victim alleges rape was videotaped; what initial probe revealed
content: Kolkata Police reported the arrest of Manujit Mishra, a former Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad leader, for allegedly raping a law student within college premises. Mishra, also a temporary staff member and lawyer, is accused of filming the assault and threatening to release it.

title: US government warns: Green Cards and Visas at risk; will be revoked if ...
content: USCIS has issued a stern warning, stating that immigrants risk losing their green cards and visas if they break the law. The agency emphasized that advocating violence, supporting terrorism, or encouraging such activities will result in ineligibility to remain in the U.S.

title: Exclusive: Gukesh vs Carlsen not happening in Vegas; why is world champion not playing?
content: World Champion D Gukesh will not be playing in the Las Vegas leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, citing exhaustion after Norway Chess. Vidit Gujrathi will replace him, donning Gukeshâ€™s red jacket. The $750,000 event runs July 16â€“20 at Wynn Las Vegas. Meanwhile, the India leg in September is cancelled, and Jan Henric Buettner will step down as CEO on July 1.

title: Live sex shows on terrace: Hyderabad couple charged viewers Rs 500-Rs 2,000
content: In Hyderabad, a couple from Amberpet was apprehended for allegedly live-streaming a sex act from their home's terrace, charging viewers via a social media app. Authorities raided their residence following an alert, discovering the couple in a semi-nude state, ready to broadcast. They confessed to streaming to alleviate financial struggles, with police seizing phones, tripods, and payment records.

title: 'Acted as mother': Latur traffic constable goes viral after slapping girls
content: A female traffic constable in Latur faced backlash after a video surfaced showing her slapping and verbally abusing three young women for riding triple-seat on a two-wheeler. Constable Pranita Musne admitted to the assault, justifying her actions as concern for road safety after witnessing them driving rashly. She has apologized for her language but stands by her intention.

title: 'Felt drowsy': Engineer arrested for LLB studentâ€™s hit-and-run death in Gurgaon
content: In Gurgaon, a civil engineer named Mohit was arrested after a fatal accident on the Delhi-Jaipur highway. His car struck and killed Harsh Singhal, a law student, and critically injured Abhishek Kumar. Mohit claimed drowsiness led to the incident near Hero Honda Chowk. Bystanders tried to chase the car, but Mohit fled.

title: How Pakistani 'Priya Sharma' lured Navy clerk to leak Op Sindoor secrets
content: Intelligence agencies arrested Vishal Yadav, a Naval Headquarters UDC, for allegedly spying for Pakistan, receiving payments through bank transfers and cryptocurrency. His activities surfaced during a review of Facebook accounts flagged in a 2022 espionage case. Yadav shared sensitive military information, including updates on military operations, and received payments ranging from Rs 5,000 to Rs 50,000.

title: 'I think it's important': Why India didn't sign SCO joint release? EAM gives 'context'
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar supported Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's decision to abstain from signing a joint statement at the SCO Defence Ministers' meeting in China. Jaishankar emphasized that the SCO's primary objective is to combat terrorism. However, one member nation blocked any reference to terrorism in the outcome document.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Sir, don't bowl ...' - Siraj slammed after opening Test defeat
content: Mohammad Kaif has criticised Mohammed Siraj's bowling performance in the first Test against England, where India suffered a five-wicket defeat. Kaif emphasized the need for Siraj to bowl with his mind and focus on line and length to take wickets. He also highlighted how England strategically attacked the other bowlers, while playing defensively against Bumrah, ultimately leading to their victory.

title: Violence over power cut in Greater Noida society: Residents assaulted by security guards
content: A violent confrontation erupted at Supertech Eco Village 1 in Greater Noida West when residents, frustrated by a prolonged power outage, were allegedly assaulted by security and maintenance staff. The dispute escalated from a peaceful complaint to physical violence, with residents reportedly being beaten with sticks and batons.

title: India slaps 27-63% anti-dumping duties on these goods from China, Taiwan
content: India has levied anti-dumping duties on plastic processing machines. These machines originate from China and Taiwan. The duties range from 27% to 63%. This action follows evidence of unfair pricing. The move aims to protect Indian manufacturers. It addresses the harm caused by dumped imports. The duties will remain for five years.

title: â€˜Fall to deathâ€™: Video of Harihar fort over-congested with tourists goes viral
content: A viral video shows a large crowd trekking to Harihar Fort in Maharashtra. The fort is known for its dangerous trail. The video raises concerns about safety and regulation. Social media users are worried about potential accidents. Some users are questioning the forest department's role. The incident has sparked a debate about managing tourist footfall in India.

title: Millions of children at risk as global vaccination rates decline, new study warns
content: A new study shows a worrying global trend. Vaccination rates are falling in many countries. This puts millions of children at risk of diseases. Measles vaccinations have declined in about 100 countries. The COVID-19 pandemic disrupted vaccination services. Misinformation also plays a role. Experts call for action to improve healthcare access. They want to restore routine immunization services.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Science in madness' - Vaughan leads praise for Pant's heroics
content: Rishabh Pant's spectacular twin centuries at Headingley, though insufficient to secure an Indian victory, have garnered widespread acclaim, with Michael Vaughan highlighting his "game-changer" status and deep cricketing intelligence. Despite Pant's heroics, India's fragile lower order and inconsistent bowling led to a five-wicket defeat for India.

title: â€˜On the pot during courtâ€™: Man attends Gujarat HC virtual hearing from toilet seat
content: A man attending a Gujarat High Court hearing via video conference was caught on camera seated on a toilet, triggering outrage. The incident occurred before Justice Nirzar S Desai's bench on June 20. This follows similar instances of inappropriate behavior in virtual courtrooms, including a litigant smoking.

title: 'Never say never': Paralympian Sheetal Devi drives car with feet - WATCH
content: Sheetal Devi, the Indian Paralympic archery star, inspires again by confidently driving a car using her feet, showcasing her unwavering spirit. Despite being born with phocomelia, she has defied limitations, achieving international success in para-archery. Her record-breaking performance at the Paris Paralympics and her ability to master new skills continue to inspire millions.

title: 19 vehicles in MP CM Mohan Yadavâ€™s convoy towed after water filled in tank
content: A significant disruption occurred in Ratlam when at least 19 vehicles in Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav's convoy broke down after refueling at a local petrol pump. The vehicles were reportedly filled with diesel contaminated with water, leading to their breakdown and subsequent towing.

title: Kolkata gangrape: NCW takes cognisance; BJP, TMC clash with each other
content: A female student was allegedly gang-raped at South Calcutta Law College, leading to the arrest of three individualsâ€”two former students and a staff member. The incident, which occurred on June 25, has sparked outrage and a political clash, with the BJP accusing the TMC of enabling a culture of impunity.

title: Kolkata shocker: Student raped on law college premises; staffer among 3 arrested
content: A student reported a rape incident at a Kolkata law college. Police acted swiftly, arresting three individuals. The accused are Manojit Mishra, Zaib Ahmed, and Pramit Mukhopadhyay. One is accused of the assault, while the others allegedly abetted the crime. They will appear in court in Alipore. Police seek custody for further investigation. The victim's identity remains protected.

title: Jaishankar thanks Iran for helping evacuate Indians amid Israel conflict
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar thanked Iran for aiding the safe evacuation of Indian nationals during the recent conflict with Israel. Operation Sindhu, launched on June 18, has brought home over 4,400 Indians via 19 special flights from Iran and Israel. Evacuations occurred from cities like Mashhad, Yerevan, and Ashgabat, even including some nationals from Nepal and Sri Lanka.

title: Union minister backs RSS call to review â€˜socialistâ€™, â€˜secularâ€™ in Preamble
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has criticized PM Modi and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, alleging a conspiracy to remove poor voters from electoral rolls through the Election Commission's special revision. He questions the timing and feasibility of creating a new voter list just before elections.

title: IND vs ENG: India resume training ahead of 2nd Test; Bumrah sits out net session
content: Following their Headingley defeat, the Indian cricket team has commenced preparations for the second Test against England in Birmingham. Despite Jasprit Bumrah's presence, he refrained from on-field activities, while Prasidh Krishna was also absent from bowling drills. Coach Gautam Gambhir engaged in discussions with pacers, and players participated in net sessions.

title: 'Wanted to kill Khamenei but ...': Israel reveals how Ayatollah evaded assassination
content: During the recent conflict, Israeli defence minister Israel Katz revealed that Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was a target for assassination but evaded capture by going into hiding. Despite this, Israel launched airstrikes, killing Iranian commanders and nuclear scientists, aiming to destabilize Iran's leadership.

title: Watch: Elephants go on rampage at Jagannath Rath Yatra in Gujarat
content: During the Rath Yatra celebrations in Ahmedabad, a male elephant became agitated. The incident occurred near Desai ni Pol in Khadia. Authorities swiftly administered a tranquilizer injection. Female elephants helped to herd the male elephant away. No injuries were reported, and the crowd was quickly controlled. The male elephant is now isolated. The remaining 17 female elephants continued the procession.

title: Kolkata horror: TMC, BJP trade barbs over rape case in law college
content: A rape case at a Kolkata law college has sparked political controversy. Trinamool Congress (TMC) blames Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) for delaying the Aparajita Anti-Rape Bill. BJP accuses the Mamata Banerjee government of inaction due to political reasons. Three men, including students and staff, have been arrested in connection with the incident.

title: 'We were told there was a threat': Rohit Sharma spills secrets of IND vs PAK clash
content: Rohit Sharma recalls the electrifying atmosphere surrounding India-Pakistan matches, describing it as a festival-like experience. He lauded Rishabh Pant's crucial innings and the exceptional bowling performance of Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh in the T20 World Cup clash. Sharma emphasized the strategic use of Bumrah and Arshdeep to defend a low total on a challenging pitch.

title: ÅšwiÄ…tek and Azarenka caught in feud as â€˜awkwardâ€™ handshake breaks the internet
content: A frosty handshake between Iga ÅšwiÄ…tek and Victoria Azarenka after their match at the French Open has ignited speculation among tennis fans. The brief, cold exchange, devoid of smiles or eye contact, contrasted sharply with the players' usual professionalism. While the reason remains unclear, the moment has become a major talking point, highlighting the intense emotions of elite competition.

title: After suspending Indus Treaty with Pak, India considers revising Ganges Treaty with B'desh
content: India is considering revising the Ganges Water Sharing Treaty with Bangladesh, set to expire in 2026. New Delhi seeks a new treaty reflecting its current irrigation, port maintenance, and power generation needs.

title: Mussolini returns to Rome! Italian dictator's great grandson signs for Italian football club
content: Lazio has recalled Romano Floriani Mussolini, great-grandson of Benito Mussolini, after his loan at Juve Stabia, where he made 37 appearances. Despite Juve Stabia's interest in a permanent deal, Lazio opted to bring back the 22-year-old right back. Fascist fan groups are prevalent in Italian football, with Lazio's supporters having ties to the extreme right.

title: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Reddy gets court relief in convoy death case
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court has temporarily shielded YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, former Chief Minister and YSRCP chief, from coercive police action in connection with a case involving the death of a party worker. This occurred during a political tour when a vehicle from Reddy's convoy fatally struck a man.

title: Hailee Steinfeld drops jaws while living her best â€˜wife lifeâ€™ with Josh Allen
content: Hailee Steinfeld is currently honeymooning in the Maldives with Josh Allen, showcasing a series of stunning all-white designer outfits. The actress and musician, who recently married, shared images of herself in Cult Gaia ensembles, including a feathered gown and a plissÃ© top with a skirt. She also promoted her Angel Margarita cocktail brand while enjoying the tropical scenery.

title: Sources: Ujiri out as Raptors vice chair, president
content: Masai Ujiri is out as vice chairman and president of the Raptors, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Team in top five told not to pick Bailey
content: Ace Bailey's representatives informed a team drafting inside the top five that they didn't want that team to select the Rutgers wing and that he wouldn't report if it did, sources told ESPN.

title: 76ers draft Broome, Suns land Fleming in Round 2
content: Johni Broome went to the 76ers with the No. 35 pick while Rasheer Fleming ended up with the Suns via trade as the NBA draft wrapped up.

title: Rays' Franco found guilty in sexual abuse case
content: Rays shortstop Wander Franco was found guilty of sexual abuse of a minor in the Dominican Republic and received a suspended two-year prison sentence Thursday.

title: Sources: Texas State closing on move to Pac-12
content: Texas State officials began alerting Sun Belt officials of its formal offer to the Pac-12 and plans to accept, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets fear Canning has Achilles injury, await MRI
content: The Mets' Griffin Canning is set to undergo imaging after leaving Thursday's start because of a noncontact injury, and the team fears it's his Achilles.

title: Alabama gets commitment from No. 3 RB Crowell
content: Alabama secured its highest-ranked commitment in the 2026 class Thursday when four-star rusher Ezavier Crowell, ESPN's No. 3 running back prospect and No. 2 recruit from the state of Alabama, committed to the Crimson Tide.

title: Alcaraz-Fognini among key Wimbledon openers
content: Carlos Alcaraz will begin his quest for a third straight Wimbledon title against dangerous Italian Fabio Fognini, and women's top seed Aryna Sabalenka will open her campaign versus Canadian qualifier Carson Branstine.

content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: Haaland outpaces Messi, MbappÃ© to 300 goals

title: Real Madrid advance, set up Juventus CWC clash
content: Real Madrid sealed their passage to the Club World Cup round of 16 as Group H leaders, defeating Salzburg 3-0 on Thursday night at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia.

title: Athletic press LaLiga on BarÃ§a signing Williams
content: Athletic Club have confirmed they met with LaLiga to question Barcelona's ability to sign players within the league's financial fair play rules amid the Catalan side's ongoing pursuit of Nico Williams.

title: Hayes on Lavelle's stellar return: 'Only one Rose'
content: Rose Lavelle scored a goal and added an assist in her first international minutes in nearly seven months Thursday as the United States beat Ireland 4-0 at Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City, Colorado.

title: Pep: 'Long time' since Man City played this well
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola said his players got the chance to remember "what it was like to be a good team" as they thrashed Juventus 5-2.

title: Mexico's ChÃ¡vez out of Gold Cup after tearing ACL
content: Mexico midfielder Luis Chavez tore his right anterior cruciate ligament while training ahead of the Gold Cup quarterfinal match against Saudi Arabia and will now depart camp to receive medical treatment.

title: Liverpool sign Kerkez, spending nears $197M
content: Liverpool have completed the signing of Bournemouth left-back Milos Kerkez, the Premier League champions have announced.

content: While the KIADB is wants to acquire 1,777 acres of land spread across 13 villages in Devanahalli taluk for industrial development, farmers and other landholders are worried of being displaced without any means of livelihood.

content: An employee of an automobile showroom was run over while offloading a premium car from a trailer at Chalikkavattom on June 22, 2025

title: Mullaperiyar dam shutters likely to be opened on Saturday
content: If water level touches 136 feet, shutters will be opened, says T.N. Idukki Collector orders shifting of 3,220 people to 20-odd relief camps by 8 p.m. on Friday

content: A total of 63 students, who successfully completed their internships, have now secured placements with leading IT companies

content: A majority of the cases handled by the extension centres were related to domestic violence, familial disputes, alcoholism, drugs, mobile phone addiction, financial issues, and issues related to children

content: Social media handles of the prime accused revealed that he is a former president of the collegeâ€™s Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad unit, and the organisational secretary of the south Kolkata wing of the TMCâ€™s student body

content: It asks State government to respond to petitions alleging irregularities in the reservation roster for the polls

title: At SFI national conference, delegates urged to use culture, social media as tools to counter misinterpretations
content: Journalist Sashi Kumar and theatre activist M.K. Raina call upon SFI activists to counter mis-representations and untruths, while spreading the truth, using the same tools used by the right wing

title: RSS mask comes off; it wants 'Manusmriti', not Constitution: Rahul Gandhi
content: The RSS, BJP do not want the Constitution, they want 'Manusmriti'. They aim to strip the marginalised and poor of their rights and enslave them again, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

content: District unit presidents tasked with initiating seat-sharing discussions with LDF leadership at the district level

title: SFI delegates laud hospitality of Kozhikode
content: Participants from outside Kerala have especially appreciated the warmth of Kozhikode, finding it conducive to sharing their cultural experiences and building connections across regional boundaries

title: Intern at IIT-Madras sexually harassed in campus, food court staff arrested
content: The accused youth who held a stick went closer to her and pulled her hair. Raising an alarm, she managed to escape.

content: Her book The Lucky Ones mines generational family trauma to document three months of sectarian violence in Ms. Chowdharyâ€™s hometown Ahmedabad during 2002 Gujarat riots

content: Young Indians organises two-day Youth Indians Parliament 2.0 in Tiruchi; the senior MP from the DMK also responds to questions from students during an interaction

content: The aircraft, which made an emergency landing on June 14, is awaiting repairs at the airport after developing an engineering issue

content: In a covert strike reminiscent of the infamous "Red Wedding" from Game of Thrones, Israeli military generals executed a meticulously planned operation on June 13th to eliminate Iran's top military commanders.

content: After the gang-rape of a law student in Kolkata triggered a political firestorm, the Trinamool Congress has admitted that the main accused is linked to the party but insisted that this would not come in the way of him getting strict punishment.

content: When the officials reached the spot, they found many elderly people tied up in their clothes and locked in rooms.

title: Trump Plans Executive Orders To Power AI Growth In Race With China
content: The Trump administration is readying a package of executive actions aimed at boosting energy supply to power the US expansion of artificial intelligence, according to sources.

title: Office Party Days After Plane Crash, Air India Venture Sacks 4 Senior Staff
content: Four senior employees of Air India's airport gateway services provider AISATS have been told to resign after a video showing employees partying in the workplace went viral on social media.

title: Brothers Blame Influencer Mum's 'Conspiracy Theories' After Sister's Death
content: Gabriel Shemirani blames his influencer mother's belief in conspiracy theories about medicine for his sister's death from cancer, after she rejected chemotherapy.

title: Jagannath Rath Yatra: Adani Group Begins "Prasad Seva" For Pilgrims At Puri Dham
content: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group on Friday started 'Prasad Seva' for the Lord Jagannath devotees in Puri, as they congregate in the holy town in large numbers for the nine-day chariot festival.

title: India's Rice Bins Are Stuffed And Another Record Crop Coming
content: India's stash of rice is running at the highest for this time in at least two decades, raising the risk it will run out of room to store it all as another record crop looms.

title: Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez To Exchange Wedding Vows In Star-Studded Venice Party
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sanchez were set to exchange marriage vows at a ceremony in Venice on Friday, part of a three-day wedding extravaganza that has attracted dozens of celebrity guests but also protests by local activists.

title: After 2 Weeks Of Saying No, UK Agrees To Move Stranded F-35B To Kerala Hangar
content: The British F-35B fighter jet, stuck in Kerala for two weeks after it made an emergency landing, will be moved to the hangar of the airport once "engineering teams from the UK arrive with specialist equipment."

title: Rome, 20 Other Italian Cities On Red Alert For Heat This Weekend
content: Italy's health ministry warned residents and tourists of soaring temperatures across the country, issuing a red alert for 21 cities this weekend, including Rome and Venice, as temperatures could rise to 37 degrees Celsius.

title: Chile Observatory Captures Universe With 3,200-Megapixel Camera
content: Chile's Vera C. Rubin Observatory, which boasts the world's largest digital camera,  has begun displaying its first images of the cosmos, allowing astronomers to figure out how the solar system formed and whether an asteroid poses a threat to Earth.

title: Norway Princess' Son Faces Rape, Assault Charges
content: The 28-year-old son of Norway's crown princess is suspected of three rapes and more than a dozen other offences, Norwegian police said as they announced the closure of an investigation launched 10 months ago.

title: Russia To Train 600 Chinese Soldiers To Counter US, NATO Weapons: Report
content: Russia is planning to train at least 600 Chinese soldiers this year to counter the US and NATO weapons, according to a new report in the Ukrainian media.

title: "It's In Your DNA": Pentagon Chief Blasts Reporter On Trump Question
content: US Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth launched a blistering attack on the media, accusing journalists of rooting against President Donald Trump and deliberately undermining the success of America's recent military strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: In Crackdown On Illegal Immigrants, Assam Plans To Allow Only Top District Officials To Issue Aadhaar: Himanta Sarma
content: The Assam government is considering empowering only district commissioners (DCs) to issue Aadhaar to adults in a bid to prevent illegal immigrants from obtaining the unique biometric identity number.

title: Adani Group Becomes India's Fastest-Growing Brand, Value Up By 82%
content: The Adani Group has emerged as the fastest-growing Indian brand this year, with its brand value up by 82 per cent, according to a new report.

title: Sri Lanka Supreme Court Stops Land Grab From War-Affected Tamils
content: Sri Lanka's top court halted a government move to acquire land in northern regions still reeling from the consequences 16 years after the end of a decades-long civil war.

title: Israel Would Have Killed Ayatollah Khamenei If Given Opportunity: Minister
content: Defence Minister Israel Katz told media that Israel would have killed Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei during the war between the two countries if the opportunity had presented itself.

title: Battling To Survive, Hamas Faces Defiant Clans And Doubts Over Iran
content: Short of commanders, deprived of much of its tunnel network and unsure of support from its ally Iran, Hamas is battling to survive in Gaza in the face of rebellious local clans and relentless Israeli military pressure.

title: Week 5 preview: Key stats, players for Redwoods homecoming
content: The action heads to San Diego this weekend. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Five underappreciated starting pitchers you need to grab now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft looks at the surprising lack of love for some of the starting pitchers with very strong underlying metrics.

title: 10 undervalued pass-catchers with intriguing upside or safer floors
content: Matt Bowen lists his favorites with week-winning potential and others who are dependable, despite lower ADPs.

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation forms special squad to monitor waste dumping in 10 wards surrounding airport
content: Step taken as part of measures to prevent bird hits. The squads, consisting of health inspectors from various circles, will work in three shifts and will be present on the ground round-the-clock

content: â‚¹58.3 lakh has been allocated for renovation of guest house at Munnar and â‚¹54.45 lakh for Devikulam guest house

title: KPCC seeks to quash â€˜captainâ€™ controversy, attributes Nilambur bypoll win to â€˜Team UDFâ€™

content: â€˜SST Masalaâ€™ brand promoted by a unit set up by the Spastics Society of Tiruchi in 2010 to help parents of children with special needs produces up to two tonnes of ground spices and flours a month

content: Amala, the recipient of the vehicle, was earlier felicitated during the Raj Bhavanâ€™s Womenâ€™s Day celebration

title: Draft Bill on security, minimum wages for domestic workers submitted to Telangana Labour dept
content: The over 11 lakh domestic workers in the State are mainly located in Hyderabad and other major urban centres and are covered under the Telangana Labour Departmentâ€™s notification on total wages

title: After prolonged pause, BJP initiates steps to expedite election of new president
content: Poll dates announced for Tripura and Andhra Pradesh; senior leaders appointed to oversee elections in key States

title: HC expresses concern at 12 of the 13 universities in Kerala not having regular Vice-Chancellors
content: Court dismisses petition filed by senate members of Kerala University, challenging the appointment of Mohanan Kunnummal as the V-C in-charge of the university by the Chancellor

title: Information board at Telanganaâ€™s sole geo-heritage site inaugurated; presence of rock paintings, structural significance mentioned
content: The siteâ€™s geological importance lies in its unique rock formations including caves and rock shelters and the insights they provide into Indiaâ€™s geological past

title: Indian team in U.S. for last attempt at trade deal
content: July 8 marks the last day of the 90-day pause Mr. Trump had allowed on the â€˜Liberation Dayâ€™ higher tariffs he had imposed on imports from other countries, including India. If that date elapses without either an extension or a trade deal between India and the U.S., then Indian exports to the U.S. will be subject to 26% tariffs from July 9 onwards.

title: Rahul assures political power to tribals within Congress to strengthen community socially
content: I want to help the tribals, for which the community will have to get united, and those actually fighting for the rights of the tribals need to come forward, says Rahul Gandhi

title: Telangana govt to enact legislation soon for gig and platform workers: Labour MinisterÂ Vivek Venkat Swamy
content: Mr. Vivek Venkat Swamy says govt actively examining constitution of a board for gig and platform workers

title: Two Ghulam Nabi Azad-led DPAP leaders return to Congress in Jammu & Kashmir with remorse
content: They were welcomed by AICC general secretary in charge of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh Naseer Hussain, Union Territory party chief Tariq Hamid Karra and others

title: Asiatic wild dog returns to Assamâ€™s Kaziranga landscape
content: The dhole was once thought to have been exterminated from the area better known as the domain of the one-horned rhinoceros

title: Will pad up and bat if captain tells me to: Kanhaiya on contesting Bihar polls
content: If the captain tells me to sit outside and deliver drinks for those at the crease, I will do that. And if the captain tells me to, I will also pad up and bat, says Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar

title: Farms in Sogane flooded during rains as four tanks were filled up to construct Shivamogga airport
content: Rainwater that used to collect in those tanks is released to the left bank canal of the Bhadra Reservoir Project, that passes close to the airport compound wall

title: Suspects involved in last week blast CRPF camp held; attacks in three towns foiled: Himanta
content: The 'key person' involved with the plan is still absconding, though police have his whereabouts and he will be nabbed soon, Mr. Sarma said.

content: The Rajmargyatra app provides travellers with comprehensive information about national highways and also offers them an efficient grievance redressal mechanism.

content: The machines are intended to provide dialysis treatment at no cost to patients from economically disadvantaged backgrounds across Sandur taluk

title: Gujarat High Court extends Asaram's temporary bail in rape case till July 7
content: The division Bench of Justices Ilesh Vora and Sandeep Bhatt extended Asaram's temporary bail, granted on March 28 initially for three months, during the hearing of the plea

content: Ilia Topuria reveals his future fight plans if he beats Charles Oliveira for the vacant lightweight title . the 28-year-old will look to become a two-weight champion on saturday . topuria said retirement comments from December were heavily influenced by the drastic amount of weight he had to cut to make the featherweight limit .

title: Which NBA teams' drafts get an A? What about a C-? We have grades for all 30
content: my team grades for the 2025 draft are the only ones you'll read that aren't concerned with results . no team, not even the Brooklyn Nets, drafts enough players in one year . trades are also considered .

title: Bradley's take: Will Paul's hook land better than Julio CÃ©sar ChÃ¡vez Jr.'s?
content: a 10-round cruiserweight bout against former middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. will be his 13th pro fight of 2025 . this will be Paul's first pro fight against a former boxing champ other than last November's fight against the then 58-year-old Mike Tyson . Chavez has fought only once since 2021 .

title: Who could be a WNBA All-Star starter? Predictions, questions, more for 2025
content: fans' votes count for 50%, players count for 25% . top four guards and top six frontcourt players will be the starters . coaches cannot vote for players on their own teams . the two players with the most fan votes will serve as captains and draft players on "WNBA Countdown"

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, live reports
content: the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach . the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster . a multiplayer, multipick deal tipped off the trade season with the Orlando Magic . our insiders will be tracking latest signings .

title: NBA trade tracker: Live updates during the 2025 draft
content: the 2025 offseason is here, and deals are getting done . on the last day of the season, the Phoenix Suns traded MVP Kevin Durant to the Houston Rockets for Jalen Green and Dillon Brooks . the grizzlies moved guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for a package of players .

title: Best picks, surprising moves and top trades: Making sense of Round 1
content: the 2025 draft began with the first of three players selected by the Dallas Mavericks . it ended with the LA Clippers drafting center Yanic Konan Niederhauser with pick no. 30 . the Phoenix Suns landing the top-ranked center in Duke's Khaman Maluach .
